taskbody.prereq: To commit conflicting changes, the Team Synchronizing perspective must be opened. (For more information, refer to section Opening the Team Synchronizing perspective ).
taskbody.context: This section describes how to resolve conflicts when files are marked in conflict after a synchronization. It is highly recommended to work in collaboration with people involved in the conflict when overriding changes on the central repository.

step.cmd: Right-click on the file and select Update .
step.stepresult: Your local version is updated with non-conflicting changes retrieved from the last revision.

step.cmd: Right-click on the file and select Open in Compare Editor .
step.stepresult: Your local version is placed on the left side and the central repository version on the right.

step.cmd:
One by one, click
to copy current changes from left to right to resolve the conflicting changes. If you do not want the central repository version to override your local one, just ignore it.
step.stepresult: The highlighted section from the repository is copied to your local version.

step.cmd: (Optional) To view the people involved in the conflict, open the show history to see names of the last commits.
When all conflicts are resolved, right-click on the file and select Mark as merged .
Right-click on the folder above the model and select Commit .
